en: Luc Silhol, a beekeeper for about thirty years now, welcomes you to his honey factory in Courry at the foot of the Cévennes, and offers you his locally produced honeys as well as all the products derived from honey. The honey is extracted on the spot, as the harvest progresses... You will find : lavender honey fir tree honey acacia honey scrubland honey heather honey chestnut honey rosemary honey linden honey mountain honey... But also pollen, beeswax, Propolis, mead, royal jelly, gingerbread and local flavours... Discover our beehives... Gold medal for Chestnut tree honey, honey from the garrigue Militant du goût du Gard in 2016 and 2020 Gold medal of the militant du goût du Gard for Chestnut tree honey and for honey from the garrigue in 2016 Sale of honey in Courry, in Ardèch, at the foot of the Cévennes Products derived from honey, propolys, pollen, mead, wax Honey from the Cévennes The benefits of products derived from honey: Pollen is an excellent tonic, regulator of intestinal functions. During the second week of their life, the honey bees secrete a glandular substance with special properties. Propolis allows a biological fight against microbial infections, and has anaesthetic and healing properties.  For more details on the benefits of pollen or propolis, come to the Miellerie de Courry...
fr: Luc Silhol, apiculteur depuis une trentaine d'année vous accueille dans sa Miellerie à Courry au pied des Cévennes, et vous propose ses miels produits localement ainsi que tous les produits dérivés du miel  L'extraction du miel se fait sur place, au fil des récoltes... Vous y trouverez du : miel de lavande miel de sapin miel d'acacia miel de garrigues miel de bruyère miel de châtaignier miel de romarin miel de tilleul miel de montagne... Mais aussi du pollen, de la cire d'abeille, du Propolis, de l'hydromel, de la gelée royale, du pain d'épices et des saveurs du terroir... Découvrez nos ruches... Médaille d'or pour le miel de châtaigner, miel de garrigue Militant du goût du Gard en 2016 et 2020 Médaille d'or du militant du goût du Gard pour le miel de Chataigner et pour le miel de garrigue en 2016 Vente de miel à Courry, en Ardèch, au pied des Cévennes Produits dérivés du miel, propolys, pollen, hydromel, cire Miel des Cévennes Les bienfaits des produits dérivés du miel :  Le pollen est un excellent tonifiant, régulateur des fonctions intestinales. La gelée royale, c'est pendant la deuxième semaine de leur vie que les abeilles nourricières sécrètent une substance glandulaire aux propriétés particulières. La Propolis permet une lutte biologique contre les infections microbiennes, et a des propriétés anesthésiantes et cicatrisantes.  Pour plus de détails sur les bienfaits du pollen ou de la propolis, venez à la Miellerie de Courry...

en:
Luc Silhol, beekeeper for about thirty years, welcomes you to his Honey House in Courry at the foot of the Cevennes, and offers you his locally produced honeys as well as all products derived from honey
The extraction of honey is done on the spot, with the wire of the harvests...
You will find :
lavender honeyfir honeyacacia honeygarrigue honeyheather honeychestnut honeyrosemary honeylinden honeymountain honey ... But also pollen, beeswax, Propolis, mead, royal jelly, gingerbread and local flavors ...
Discover our hives...
Gold medal for the honey of chestnut tree, honey of scrubland Militant of the taste of Gard in 2016 and 2020Gold medal of the Militant of the taste of Gard for the honey of Chataigner and for the honey of scrubland in 2016
Honey sales in Courry, in Ardèch, at the foot of the CevennesHoney by-products, propolys, pollen, mead, waxHoney from the Cevennes
The benefits of products derived from honey 
Pollen is an excellent tonic, regulating intestinal functions.
Royal jelly, it is during the second week of their life that the nurse bees secrete a glandular substance with particular properties.Propolis allows a biological fight against the microbial infections, and has anaesthetic and healing properties. For more details on the benefits of pollen or propolis, come to the Miellerie de Courry...
